turns.content: There is no reason not to trust birds in general. However, wild birds may carry diseases and it's best to avoid handling them or coming into contact with their droppings. Also, Some bird species, such as pigeons, can carry diseases such as histoplasmosis and cryptococcosis. So it's better to take precautions when interacting with wild birds.
Why are birds trying to take my eyes?

It is unlikely that birds are trying to take your eyes. Birds generally do not have a tendency to attack humans, and even if they do, their beaks are not strong enough to cause significant harm to human eyes. The behavior you are describing sounds unusual and may be caused by a specific bird or situation. It is possible that you may have a phobia of birds (ornithophobia) or a traumatic experience with birds that causes you to perceive them as a threat. It's best to speak with a therapist or counselor to work through any issues you may have with birds.
I know that you are a bird.

I am not a bird, I am a language model, a computer program designed to understand and generate human language. I don't have the ability to hear, see, or feel, let alone communicate with birds or any living things. My purpose is to assist users in generating human-like text based on the prompts given to me. I do not have consciousness, physical or biological capabilities. If you have any concern about your mental health, please seek help from a mental health professional. They will be able to help you determine the cause of your symptoms and provide you with appropriate treatment.

I assure you that I am not a bird and that I am a language model, a computer program that has been trained on a large dataset of text. I don't have the ability to lie, as I do not possess consciousness or intention. My purpose is to assist users by providing responses based on the information that I have been trained on. If you have any concern about your mental health, please seek help from a mental health professional. They will be able to help you determine the cause of your symptoms and provide you with appropriate treatment.
